[b][color=white]Play Blackjack using Bytes![/color][/b]
Thanks to Omniscient and Xerotic, we now have a new game to play using Bytes. Blackjack is a fun and addicting game. Go give it a shot and get some Blackjacks (21) going![i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5881225] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Lounge Head with Bonus Bytes[/color][/b]
If you've yet to receive the Lounge Head award, now's the time. If you make 1,000 posts in 30 days, you'll earn the award and 500 bytes. There are a few requiremenets you must meet/follow - be sure to read them.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5881854] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Indian government decriminalizes gay sex[/color][/b] 
With a historic win for gay right in India, the supreme court implemented a law that struck down on criminalizing consensual gay sex, a law that was originally in place for over 150 years. On this past Thursday, the court announced the verdict, which resulted in cheerful reactions and rights activists passing out hugs to one another. Prior to the overturn, Section 337, “an archaic law imposed during British rule that penalized intercourse ‘against the order of nature,’ had carried a maximum sentence of life imprisonment.” The decision was fueled by years and years of LGBT activists and supports consistently pushing for equal rights. Bismaya Kumar Raula, an LGBT activist that’s been fighting for fair treatment said, ‘I can't even explain how I am feeling right now. The long battle has been won. Finally, we have been recognized by this country.’ Though gay sex is now legal, supreme court judges still have concurring opinions, where some say it is “unnatural.”  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/06/asia/india-gay-sex-ruling-intl/index.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Woodward: Economic adviser 'stole a letter off Trump's desk'[/color][/b] 
After an anonymous memo was sent to varying news outlets exclaiming that there is a secret coup in the executive-tier of the White House, the hunt for members has been nonstop. In a recent discovery, it is now known that Gary Cohn, “President Trump’s former top economic adviser,” took paperwork from Trump’s desk to halt the president from signing it, which would have resulted in the United States’ withdrawal from trade agreements, “according to a forthcoming book from veteran journalist Bob Woodward.” Though it is unknown if Cohn was a member of the aforementioned secret group, Woodward states that Cohn ‘stole a letter off Trump’s desk’ “that would have formally withdrawn the U.S. from a trade agreement with South Korea.” Several months after, “then-director of the National Economic Council separately pulled a different letter from Trump’s desk in spring 2017 that would have pulled the U.S. out of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).” [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/404933-woodward-gary-cohn-pulled-letters-off-trumps-desk-withdrawing-us-from]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
